title: Italian Words in English
description: From piano to volcano, explore the rich Italian heritage behind many beloved English words!

questions.question: The word 'piano' comes from the Italian 'pianoforte.' What does 'pianoforte' literally mean?
Which English word for a type of hooded waterproof garment comes from the Italian 'cappuccio' (hood)?
The word 'volcano' comes from Italian. It is named after which Roman deity?
Which English word for a balcony or seating area in a theater comes from the Italian 'balcone'?
The word 'fiasco' is borrowed from Italian. What does 'fiasco' literally mean in Italian?
Which musical term meaning 'at a brisk tempo' comes directly from Italian?
The word 'graffiti' is Italian in origin. What is the singular form of 'graffiti'?
Which English word for a type of ice cream comes from the Italian 'gelato,' meaning 'frozen'?
The word 'influenza' came to English from Italian. What did Italians believe caused the disease?
Which English word for a public square or marketplace comes from the Italian 'piazza'?
The word 'umbrella' comes from the Italian 'ombrella,' derived from 'ombra.' What does 'ombra' mean?
Which word for the practice of isolating ships to prevent disease spread comes from the Italian 'quaranta' (forty)?
The word 'casino' is Italian. What does it literally mean?
Which architectural term meaning 'a roofed gallery or arcade' comes from the Italian 'loggia'?
The word 'stiletto' comes from Italian. What does the Italian 'stilo' (its root) mean?
